                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3 font-weight-bold">Glossary</h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                            count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is
                                            termed as business Decline. </li>
                                        <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                                        <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                            is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received
                                            online from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li>Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money</li>
                                        <li>Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabTwoJun22" class="tab-pane">

											</tr>

								<p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
								<ul class="list">
									<li>App volume in table is basis the Payer App logic, i.e the financial transaction is attributed to the PSP in UPI on the Payer’s side.</li>
									<li>All B2C (Business to Customer) &amp; B2B (Business to Business) transactions is attributed to respective PSP .</li>
									<li>From January 2021 onwards, ‘On-us Transactions’ in UPI that are not processed and settled through the UPI Central System is shown under ‘On-us Transactions’ column.</li>
									<li>Apps which has volume less than 10,000 is included under ‘Other Apps’.</li>
									<li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# volume.</li>
									<li>WhatsApp*: Maximum registered user base of forty (40) million in UPI</li>
								</ul>

                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3 font-weight-bold">Glossary</h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li>Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                            count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is
                                            termed as business Decline.
                                        </li>
                                        <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                                        <li>PSP - Payment Service Provider</li>
                                        <li>Payer PSP - Under this function a bank can onboard a customer, create his/ her UPI ID, create device binding which is used as a first factor of Authentication, using this customer can enter their UPI PIN to approve
                                            a financial transaction or non-financial request where ever necessary. </li>
                                        <li>Payee PSP - Under this function a bank can onboard a customer/merchant & allow them to receive money basis allocated UPI ID or raise a Collect request. It is also known as beneficiary PSP/resolving PSP. </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabThreeJun22" class="tab-pane">
								<h5 class="mb-3 font-weight-bold">UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</h5>
                                <div class="table-responsive">
                                    <table class="table table-bordered">
                                        <thead class="font-weight-bold">

                                                <th colspan="2">P2P</th>
                                                <th colspan="2">P2M</th>

								<div class="border rounded mb-5">
									<picture>
										<source type="image/webp" srcset="/images/npci/upi/upi-jun22-p2p-p2m-value.webp" alt=""  /> 
										<img src="/images/npci/upi/upi-jun22-p2p-p2m-value.jpg">
									</picture>
                                </div>
                                <div class="border rounded">
									<picture>
										<source type="image/webp" srcset="/images/npci/upi/upi-jun22-p2p-p2m-volume.webp" alt=""  /> 
										<img src="/images/npci/upi/upi-jun22-p2p-p2m-volume.jpg">
									</picture>
                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3 font-weight-bold">Glossary</h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.
                                        </li>
                                        <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div> 
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>

                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3 font-weight-bold">Glossary</h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                            count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is
                                            termed as business Decline. </li>
                                        <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                                        <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                            is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received
                                            online from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li>Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money</li>
                                        <li>Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabTwoMay22" class="tab-pane">

								</div>
								<p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
								<ul class="list">
									<li>App volume in table is basis the Payer App logic, i.e the financial transaction is attributed to the PSP in UPI on the Payer’s side.</li>
									<li>All B2C (Business to Customer) &amp; B2B (Business to Business) transactions is attributed to respective PSP .</li>
									<li>From January 2021 onwards, ‘On-us Transactions’ in UPI that are not processed and settled through the UPI Central System is shown under ‘On-us Transactions’ column.</li>
									<li>Apps which has volume less than 10,000 is included under ‘Other Apps’.</li>
									<li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# volume.</li>
									<li>WhatsApp*: Maximum registered user base of forty (40) million in UPI</li>
								</ul>
                            </div>
							<div id="innerTabFourMay22" class="tab-pane">
								<h5 class="mb-3 font-weight-bold">UPI Payer PSP Performance</h5>
                                <div class="table-responsive">
                                    <table class="table table-bordered">

                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3 font-weight-bold">Glossary</h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li>Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                            count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is
                                            termed as business Decline.
                                        </li>
                                        <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                                        <li>PSP - Payment Service Provider</li>
                                        <li>Payer PSP - Under this function a bank can onboard a customer, create his/ her UPI ID, create device binding which is used as a first factor of Authentication, using this customer can enter their UPI PIN to approve
                                            a financial transaction or non-financial request where ever necessary. </li>
                                        <li>Payee PSP - Under this function a bank can onboard a customer/merchant & allow them to receive money basis allocated UPI ID or raise a Collect request. It is also known as beneficiary PSP/resolving PSP. </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabThreeMay22" class="tab-pane">
								<h5 class="mb-3 font-weight-bold">UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</h5>
                                <div class="table-responsive">
                                    <table class="table table-bordered">
                                        <thead class="font-weight-bold">
                                            <tr>
                                                <th colspan="7">UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</th>
                                            </tr>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th rowspan="2">Month</th>
                                                <th colspan="2">Total</th>
                                                <th colspan="2">P2P</th>
                                                <th colspan="2">P2M</th>
                                            </tr>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                                <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                                <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                                <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                                <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                                <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                            </tr>
                                        </thead>
                                        <tbody>
                                            <tr>
                                                <td>May'22</td>

                                            </tr>
                                        </tbody>
                                    </table>
                                </div>
								<div class="border rounded mb-5">
									<picture>
										<source type="image/webp" srcset="/images/npci/upi/upi-may22-p2p-p2m-value.webp" alt=""  /> 
										<img src="/images/npci/upi/upi-may22-p2p-p2m-value.jpg">
									</picture>
                                </div>
                                <div class="border rounded">
									<picture>
										<source type="image/webp" srcset="/images/npci/upi/upi-may22-p2p-p2m-volume.webp" alt=""  /> 
										<img src="/images/npci/upi/upi-may22-p2p-p2m-volume.jpg">
									</picture>
                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3 font-weight-bold">Glossary</h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.
                                        </li>
                                        <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>

                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3 font-weight-bold">Glossary</h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                            count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is
                                            termed as business Decline. </li>
                                        <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                                        <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                            is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received
                                            online from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li>Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money</li>
                                        <li>Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabTwoApr22" class="tab-pane">

                                </div>
                                <p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
                                <ul class="list">
                                    <li>App volume in table is basis the Payer App logic, i.e the financial transaction is attributed to the PSP in UPI on the Payer’s side.</li>
                                    <li>All B2C (Business to Customer) &amp; B2B (Business to Business) transactions is attributed to respective PSP .</li>
                                    <li>From January 2021 onwards, ‘On-us Transactions’ in UPI that are not processed and settled through the UPI Central System is shown under ‘On-us Transactions’ column.
                                    </li>
                                    <li>Apps which has volume less than 10,000 is included under ‘Other Apps’.</li>
                                    <li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# volume.</li>
                                    <li>WhatsApp*: Maximum registered user base of forty (40) million in UPI</li>
                                </ul>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabThreeApr22" class="tab-pane">
                                <h5 class="mb-3 font-weight-bold">UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</h5>
                                <div class="table-responsive">
                                    <table class="table table-bordered">
                                        <thead class="font-weight-bold">
                                            <tr>
                                                <th colspan="7">UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</th>
                                            </tr>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th rowspan="2">Month</th>
                                                <th colspan="2">Total</th>
                                                <th colspan="2">P2P</th>
                                                <th colspan="2">P2M</th>
                                            </tr>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                                <th>Value (Cr)</th>

								<div class="border rounded mb-5">
									<picture>
										<source type="image/webp" srcset="/images/npci/upi/upi-apr22-p2p-p2m-value.webp" alt=""  />

                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3 font-weight-bold">Glossary</h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.
                                        </li>
                                        <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>

                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3 font-weight-bold">Glossary</h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li>Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                            count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is
                                            termed as business Decline.
                                        </li>
                                        <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                                        <li>PSP - Payment Service Provider</li>
                                        <li>Payer PSP - Under this function a bank can onboard a customer, create his/ her UPI ID, create device binding which is used as a first factor of Authentication, using this customer can enter their UPI PIN to approve
                                            a financial transaction or non-financial request where ever necessary. </li>
                                        <li>Payee PSP - Under this function a bank can onboard a customer/merchant & allow them to receive money basis allocated UPI ID or raise a Collect request. It is also known as beneficiary PSP/resolving PSP. </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>

                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                            count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is
                                            termed as business Decline. </li>
                                        <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                                        <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                            is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received
                                            online from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li>Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money</li>
                                        <li>Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabTwoMar22" class="tab-pane">

                                </div>
                                <p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
                                <ul class="list">
                                    <li>App volume in table is basis the Payer App logic, i.e the financial transaction is attributed to the PSP in UPI on the Payer’s side.</li>
                                    <li>All B2C (Business to Customer) &amp; B2B (Business to Business) transactions is attributed to respective PSP .</li>
                                    <li>From January 2021 onwards, ‘On-us Transactions’ in UPI that are not processed and settled through the UPI Central System is shown under ‘On-us Transactions’ column.
                                    </li>
                                    <li>Apps which has volume less than 10,000 is included under ‘Other Apps’.</li>
                                    <li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# volume.</li>
                                    <li>WhatsApp*: Maximum registered user base of forty (40) million in UPI</li>
                                </ul>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabThreeMar22" class="tab-pane">
                                <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></h5>
                                <div class="table-responsive">

                                </div>
                                <h5 class="mb-3 mt-4"><strong>UPI: P2P & P2M transactions by Amount Banding</strong>
                                </h5>
                                <div class="border rounded mb-5">
                                    <img src="/images/npci/upi/upi-mar-p2p-p2m-1.png">
                                </div>
                                <div class="border rounded">
                                    <img src="/images/npci/upi/upi-mar-p2p-p2m-2.png">
                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.
                                        </li>
                                        <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>

                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li>Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                            count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is
                                            termed as business Decline.
                                        </li>
                                        <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                                        <li>PSP - Payment Service Provider</li>
                                        <li>Payer PSP - Under this function a bank can onboard a customer, create his/ her UPI ID, create device binding which is used as a first factor of Authentication, using this customer can enter their UPI PIN to approve
                                            a financial transaction or non-financial request where ever necessary. </li>
                                        <li>Payee PSP - Under this function a bank can onboard a customer/merchant & allow them to receive money basis allocated UPI ID or raise a Collect request. It is also known as beneficiary PSP/resolving PSP. </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
				
				<div class="hideDD" id="yearFeb2022" style="display: none;">

                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                            count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is
                                            termed as business Decline. </li>
                                        <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                                        <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                            is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received
                                            online from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li>Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money</li>
                                        <li>Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabTwoFeb22" class="tab-pane">

                                <p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
                                <ul class="list">
                                    <li>App volume in table is basis the Payer App logic, i.e the financial transaction is attributed to the PSP in UPI on the Payer’s side.</li>
                                    <li>All B2C (Business to Customer) &amp; B2B (Business to Business) transactions is attributed to respective PSP .</li>
                                    <li>From January 2021 onwards, ‘On-us Transactions’ in UPI that are not processed and settled through the UPI Central System is shown under ‘On-us Transactions’ column.
                                    </li>
                                    <li>Apps which has volume less than 10,000 is included under ‘Other Apps’.</li>
                                    <li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# volume.</li>
                                    <li>WhatsApp*: Maximum registered user base of forty (40) million in UPI</li>
                                </ul>

								<h5 class="mb-3 mt-4"><strong>UPI: P2P & P2M transactions by Amount Banding</strong>
                                </h5>
                                <div class="border rounded mb-5">
                                    <img src="/images/npci/upi/upi-ecosystem-volume-feb22.jpg">
                                </div>
                                <div class="border rounded">
                                    <img src="/images/npci/upi/upi-ecosystem-value-feb22.jpg">
                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.
                                        </li>
                                        <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>

                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li>Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                            count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is
                                            termed as business Decline.
                                        </li>
                                        <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                                        <li>PSP - Payment Service Provider</li>
                                        <li>Payer PSP - Under this function a bank can onboard a customer, create his/ her UPI ID, create device binding which is used as a first factor of Authentication, using this customer can enter their UPI PIN to approve
                                            a financial transaction or non-financial request where ever necessary. </li>
                                        <li>Payee PSP - Under this function a bank can onboard a customer/merchant & allow them to receive money basis allocated UPI ID or raise a Collect request. It is also known as beneficiary PSP/resolving PSP. </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
				
                <div class="hideDD" id="yearJan2020" style="display: none;">

                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted count of
                                transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is termed as business Decline.
                                </li>
                            <li> Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side. </li>
                            <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received online
                                from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money </li>
                            <li> Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money </li>
                            <li> Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money </li>
                            <li> Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money </li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>
                <div class="hideDD" id="yearFeb2020" style="display: none;">

                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted count of
                                transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is termed as business Decline.
                                </li>
                            <li> Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side. </li>
                            <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received online
                                from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money </li>
                            <li> Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money </li>
                            <li> Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money </li>
                            <li> Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money </li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>
                <div class="hideDD" id="yearMar2020" style="display: none;">

                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted count of
                                transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is termed as business Decline.
                                </li>
                            <li> Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side. </li>
                            <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received online
                                from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money </li>
                            <li> Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money </li>
                            <li> Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money </li>
                            <li> Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money </li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>
                <div class="hideDD" id="yearApr2020" style="display: none;">

                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted count of
                                transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is termed as business Decline.
                                </li>
                            <li> Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side. </li>
                            <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received online
                                from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money </li>
                            <li> Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money </li>
                            <li> Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money </li>
                            <li> Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money </li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>

                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                            <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>
                <div class="hideDD" id="yearMay2020" style="display: none;">

                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted count of
                                transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is termed as business Decline.
                                </li>
                            <li> Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side. </li>
                            <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received online
                                from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money </li>
                            <li> Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money </li>
                            <li> Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money </li>
                            <li> Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money </li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>

                    <p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
                    <ul class="list">
                        <li>Volume in the table represents Payer App volume.</li>
                        <li>Apps whose volume is less than 10,000 is included in ‘Other Apps’.</li>

                        <li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# Volume.</li>
                    </ul>
                    <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></h5>
                    <div class="table-responsive">
                        <table class="table table-bordered">
                            <thead>
                                <tr>
                                    <th colspan="7"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></th>

                                    <th>Volume (Mn)</th>

                                    <th>Value (Cr)</th>

                    </div>
                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                            <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>

                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted count of
                                transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is termed as business Decline.
                                </li>
                            <li> Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side. </li>
                            <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received online
                                from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money </li>
                            <li> Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money </li>
                            <li> Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money </li>
                            <li> Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money </li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>

                    </div>
                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                            <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>
                <div class="hideDD" id="yearJul2020" style="display: none;">

                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted count of
                                transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is termed as business Decline.
                                </li>
                            <li> Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side. </li>
                            <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received online
                                from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money </li>
                            <li> Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money </li>
                            <li> Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money </li>
                            <li> Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money </li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                    <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI Apps (July'20)</strong></h5>
                    <div class="table-responsive">
                        <table class="table table-bordered">
                            <thead>
                                <tr>
                                    <th colspan="8"> <strong>UPI Apps (July'20)</strong> </th>
                                </tr>
                                <tr>
                                    <th> <strong>Sr.No.</strong> </th>
                                    <th> <strong>Application Name</strong> </th>
                                    <th> <strong>Volume (Mn)</strong> </th>
                                    <th> <strong>Value (Cr)</strong> </th>
                                </tr>
                            </thead>
                            <tbody>
                                <tr>

                    <ul class="list">
                        <li>Volume in the table represents Payer App volume.</li>
                        <li>Apps whose volume is less than 10,000 is included in ‘Other Apps’.</li>

                    <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></h5>
                    <div class="table-responsive">
                        <table class="table table-bordered">
                            <thead>
                                <tr>
                                    <th colspan="7"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></th>

                                    <th colspan="2"><strong>P2M</strong></th>

                                    <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                </tr>

                    </div>
                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                            <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>
                <div class="hideDD" id="yearAug2020" style="display: none;">

                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted count of
                                transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is termed as business Decline.
                                </li>
                            <li> Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side. </li>
                            <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received online
                                from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money </li>
                            <li> Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money </li>
                            <li> Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money </li>
                            <li> Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money </li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>

                    </div>
                    <p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
                    <ul class="list">
                        <li>Volume in the table represents Payer App volume.</li>
                        <li>Apps whose volume is less than 10,000 is included in ‘Other Apps’.</li>
                        <li>Consolidated volume of the Banks Apps is been shown in the table for the banks which has more than 1 App and for banks which does merchant acquiring.</li>
                        <li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# Volume.</li>
                    </ul>
                    <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></h5>
                    <div class="table-responsive">
                        <table class="table table-bordered">
                            <thead>
                                <tr>
                                    <th colspan="7"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></th>
                                </tr>
                                <tr>
                                    <th rowspan="2"><strong>Month</strong></th>
                                    <th colspan="2"><strong>Total</strong></th>
                                    <th colspan="2"><strong>P2P</strong></th>
                                    <th colspan="2"><strong>P2M</strong></th>
                                </tr>
                                <tr>
                                    <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                    <th>Value (Cr)</th>

                                    <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                    <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                </tr>
                            </thead>

                                    <td>Aug-20</td>

                    </div>
                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                            <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>

                                <tr>
                                    <td> 29 </td>
                                    <td> IDFC FIRST Bank </td>
                                    <td> 5.70 </td>
                                    <td> 99.16% </td>
                                    <td> 0.56% </td>
                                    <td> 0.13% </td>
                                    <td> 0.15% </td>
                                </tr>
                                <tr>
                                    <td> 30 </td>
                                    <td> Dena Bank </td>
                                    <td> 5.64 </td>

                                    <td> 2.49% </td>
                                    <td> 1.42% </td>
                                    <td> 0.63% </td>
                                </tr>
                            </tbody>
                        </table>
                    </div>
                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li></li>
                            <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted count of
                                transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is termed as business Decline.
                                </li>
                            <li> Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side. </li>
                            <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received online
                                from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money </li>
                            <li> Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money </li>
                            <li> Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money </li>
                            <li> Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money </li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>

                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                            <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>
                <div class="hideDD" id="yearOct2020" style="display: none;">

                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li></li>
                            <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted count of
                                transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is termed as business Decline.
                                </li>
                            <li> Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side. </li>
                            <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received online
                                from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money </li>
                            <li> Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money </li>
                            <li> Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money </li>
                            <li> Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money </li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>

                    <ul class="list">
                        <li>Volume in the table represents Payer App volume.</li>
                        <li>Apps whose volume is less than 10,000 is included in ‘Other Apps’.</li>

                    <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></h5>
                    <div class="table-responsive">
                        <table class="table table-bordered">
                            <thead>
                                <tr>
                                    <th colspan="7"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></th>
                                </tr>
                                <tr>
                                    <th rowspan="2"><strong>Month</strong></th>
                                    <th colspan="2"><strong>Total</strong></th>
                                    <th colspan="2"><strong>P2P</strong></th>
                                    <th colspan="2"><strong>P2M</strong></th>
                                </tr>
                                <tr>
                                    <th>Volume (Mn)</th>

                                    <th>Volume (Mn)</th>

                                    <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                    <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                </tr>
                            </thead>
                            <tbody>
                                <tr>

                    </div>
                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                            <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>

                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted count of
                                transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is termed as business Decline.
                                </li>
                            <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                            <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received online
                                from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li>Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money</li>
                            <li>Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money</li>
                            <li>Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money</li>
                            <li>Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>

                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                            <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>
                <div class="hideDD" id="yearDec2020" style="display: none;">

                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted count of
                                transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is termed as business Decline.
                                </li>
                            <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                            <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received online
                                from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li>Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money</li>
                            <li>Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money</li>
                            <li>Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money</li>
                            <li>Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>

                    <p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
                    <ul class="list">
                        <li>App volume in table is basis the Payer App logic, i.e the financial transaction is been attributed to the PSP in UPI on the Payer’s side.</li>
                        <li>All B2C (Business to Customer) transactions is been included in respective PSP bank of the Application.
                        </li>
                        <li>Apps whose volume is less than 10,000 is included in ‘Other Apps’.</li>
                        <li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# volume.</li>
                    </ul>
                    <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></h5>
                    <div class="table-responsive">
                        <table class="table table-bordered">
                            <thead>
                                <tr>

                    </div>
                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                            <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>

                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted count of
                                transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is termed as business Decline.
                                </li>
                            <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                            <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received online
                                from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li>Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money</li>
                            <li>Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money</li>
                            <li>Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money</li>
                            <li>Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
