                    </div>
                    <p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
                    <ul class="list">
                        <li>App volume in table is basis the Payer App logic, i.e the financial transaction is attributed to the PSP in UPI on the Payer’s side.</li>
                        <li>All B2C (Business to Customer) & B2B (Business to Business) transactions is attributed to respective PSP .</li>
                        <li>From January 2021 onwards, ‘On-us Transactions’ in UPI that are not processed and settled through the UPI Central System is shown under ‘On-us Transactions’ column.</li>
                        <li>Apps which has volume less than 10,000 is included under ‘Other Apps’.</li>
                        <li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# volume.</li>
                    </ul>
                    <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></h5>
                    <div class="table-responsive">
                        <table class="table table-bordered">
                            <thead>
                                <tr>
                                    <th colspan="7"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></th>
                                </tr>
                                <tr>
                                    <th rowspan="2"><strong>Month</strong></th>
                                    <th colspan="2"><strong>Total</strong></th>
                                    <th colspan="2"><strong>P2P</strong></th>
                                    <th colspan="2"><strong>P2M</strong></th>
                                </tr>
                                <tr>
                                    <th>Volume (Mn)</th>

                                    <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                    <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                    <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                </tr>
                            </thead>

                                    <td>4,31,181.89</td>

                        </table>
                    </div>
                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                            <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>

                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted count of
                                transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is termed as business Decline.
                                </li>
                            <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                            <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received online
                                from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li>Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money</li>
                            <li>Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money</li>
                            <li>Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money</li>
                            <li>Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>

                    </div>
                    <p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
                    <ul class="list">
                        <li>App volume in table is basis the Payer App logic, i.e the financial transaction is attributed to the PSP in UPI on the Payer’s side.</li>
                        <li>All B2C (Business to Customer) & B2B (Business to Business) transactions is attributed to respective PSP .</li>
                        <li>From January 2021 onwards, ‘On-us Transactions’ in UPI that are not processed and settled through the UPI Central System is shown under ‘On-us Transactions’ column.</li>
                        <li>Apps which has volume less than 10,000 is included under ‘Other Apps’.</li>
                        <li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# volume.</li>
                    </ul>
                    <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></h5>
                    <div class="table-responsive">
                        <table class="table table-bordered">
                            <thead>
                                <tr>
                                    <th colspan="7"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></th>
                                </tr>
                                <tr>
                                    <th rowspan="2"><strong>Month</strong></th>
                                    <th colspan="2"><strong>Total</strong></th>
                                    <th colspan="2"><strong>P2P</strong></th>
                                    <th colspan="2"><strong>P2M</strong></th>
                                </tr>
                                <tr>
                                    <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                    <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                    <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                    <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                    <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                    <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                </tr>
                            </thead>
                            <tbody>
                                <tr>
                                    <td>Feb-21</td>
                                    <td>2,292.90</td>
                                    <td>425,062.76</td>
                                    <td>1,281.80</td>
                                    <td>354,819.42</td>
                                    <td>1,011.10</td>
                                    <td>70,243.34</td>
                                </tr>
                            </tbody>
                        </table>
                    </div>
                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                            <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>
                <div class="hideDD" id="yearMar2021" style="display: none;">

                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted count of
                                transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is termed as business Decline.
                                </li>
                            <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                            <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received online
                                from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                            <li>Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money</li>
                            <li>Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money</li>
                            <li>Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money</li>
                            <li>Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                    <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI Apps (March'21)</strong></h5>
                    <div class="table-responsive">
                        <table class="table table-bordered">
                            <thead>
                                <tr>
                                    <th colspan="12"> <strong>UPI Apps (March'21)</strong> </th>
                                </tr>
                                <tr>
                                    <th rowspan="2"> <strong>Sr.No.</strong> </th>
                                    <th rowspan="2"> <strong>Application Name</strong> </th>
                                    <th colspan="2"><strong>Customer Initiated Transactions</strong></th>

                            </tbody>
                        </table>
                    </div>
                    <p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
                    <ul class="list">
                        <li>App volume in table is basis the Payer App logic, i.e the financial transaction is attributed to the PSP in UPI on the Payer’s side.</li>
                        <li>All B2C (Business to Customer) & B2B (Business to Business) transactions is attributed to respective PSP .</li>
                        <li>From January 2021 onwards, ‘On-us Transactions’ in UPI that are not processed and settled through the UPI Central System is shown under ‘On-us Transactions’ column.</li>
                        <li>Apps which has volume less than 10,000 is included under ‘Other Apps’.</li>
                        <li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# volume.</li>
                    </ul>
                    <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></h5>
                    <div class="table-responsive">
                        <table class="table table-bordered">
                            <thead>
                                <tr>
                                    <th colspan="7"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></th>
                                </tr>
                                <tr>
                                    <th rowspan="2"><strong>Month</strong></th>
                                    <th colspan="2"><strong>Total</strong></th>
                                    <th colspan="2"><strong>P2P</strong></th>
                                    <th colspan="2"><strong>P2M</strong></th>
                                </tr>
                                <tr>
                                    <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                    <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                    <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                    <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                    <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                    <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                </tr>
                            </thead>
                            <tbody>
                                <tr>
                                    <td>Mar-21</td>
                                    <td>2,731.68</td>
                                    <td>5,04,886.44</td>
                                    <td>1,515.53</td>
                                    <td>4,21,810.19</td>
                                    <td>1,216.15</td>
                                    <td>83,076.25</td>
                                </tr>
                            </tbody>
                        </table>
                    </div>
                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                    <div class="list">
                        <ul>
                            <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                            <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>

                                    </div>
                                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                    <div class="list">
                                        <ul>
                                            <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                                count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI
                                                is termed as business Decline. </li>
                                            <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.
                                            </li>
                                            <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When
                                                reversal/credit is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                            <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not
                                                received online from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines.
                                                </li>
                                            <li>Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                            <li>Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money</li>
                                            <li>Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money
                                            </li>
                                            <li>Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money
                                            </li>
                                        </ul>
                                    </div>
                                </div>
                                <div id="innerTabTwoApr21" class="tab-pane">

                                    </div>
                                    <p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
                                    <ul class="list">
                                        <li>App volume in table is basis the Payer App logic, i.e the financial transaction is attributed to the PSP in UPI on the Payer’s side.</li>
                                        <li>All B2C (Business to Customer) &amp; B2B (Business to Business) transactions is attributed to respective PSP .</li>
                                        <li>From January 2021 onwards, ‘On-us Transactions’ in UPI that are not processed and settled through the UPI Central System is shown under ‘On-us Transactions’ column.</li>
                                        <li>Apps which has volume less than 10,000 is included under ‘Other Apps’.</li>
                                        <li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# volume.</li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                                <div id="innerTabThreeApr21" class="tab-pane">
                                    <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></h5>
                                    <div class="table-responsive">
                                        <table class="table table-bordered">
                                            <thead>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <th colspan="7"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></th>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <th rowspan="2"><strong>Month</strong></th>
                                                    <th colspan="2"><strong>Total</strong></th>

                                                    <th colspan="2"><strong>P2M</strong></th>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>

                                                </tr>

                                                    <td>Apr-21</td>

                                    </div>
                                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                    <div class="list">
                                        <ul>
                                            <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                                            <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                                        </ul>
                                    </div>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>

                                    <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI Top 30 Banks Performance (May'21)</strong></h5>
                                    <div class="table-responsive">
                                        <table class="table table-bordered">
                                            <thead>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <th colspan="8"> <strong>UPI Beneficiary Banks - Top 30 Banks
                                                            (May'21)</strong> </th>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <th>Sr.No.</th>
                                                    <th>UPI Beneficiary Banks (May-2021)</th>
                                                    <th>Total Volume (In Mn)</th>
                                                    <th>Approved %</th>
                                                    <th>BD%</th>
                                                    <th>TD%</th>
                                                    <th>Deemed Approved %</th>
                                                </tr>
                                            </thead>
                                            <tbody>
                                                <tr>

                                    </div>
                                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                    <div class="list">
                                        <ul>
                                            <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                                count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI
                                                is termed as business Decline. </li>
                                            <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.
                                            </li>
                                            <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When
                                                reversal/credit is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                            <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not
                                                received online from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines.
                                                </li>
                                            <li>Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                            <li>Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money</li>
                                            <li>Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money
                                            </li>
                                            <li>Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money
                                            </li>
                                        </ul>
                                    </div>
                                </div>
                                <div id="innerTabTwoMay21" class="tab-pane">

                                    </div>
                                    <p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
                                    <ul class="list">
                                        <li>App volume in table is basis the Payer App logic, i.e the financial transaction is attributed to the PSP in UPI on the Payer’s side.</li>
                                        <li>All B2C (Business to Customer) &amp; B2B (Business to Business) transactions is attributed to respective PSP .</li>
                                        <li>From January 2021 onwards, ‘On-us Transactions’ in UPI that are not processed and settled through the UPI Central System is shown under ‘On-us Transactions’ column.</li>
                                        <li>Apps which has volume less than 10,000 is included under ‘Other Apps’.</li>
                                        <li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# volume.</li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                                <div id="innerTabThreeMay21" class="tab-pane">
                                    <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></h5>
                                    <div class="table-responsive">
                                        <table class="table table-bordered">
                                            <thead>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <th colspan="7"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></th>

                                                <tr>

                                    </div>
                                    <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                    <div class="list">
                                        <ul>
                                            <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                                            <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                                        </ul>
                                    </div>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>

                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                            count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is
                                            termed as business Decline. </li>
                                        <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                                        <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                            is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received
                                            online from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li>Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money</li>
                                        <li>Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>

                                </div>
                                <p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
                                <ul class="list">
                                    <li>App volume in table is basis the Payer App logic, i.e the financial transaction is attributed to the PSP in UPI on the Payer’s side.</li>
                                    <li>All B2C (Business to Customer) &amp; B2B (Business to Business) transactions is attributed to respective PSP .</li>
                                    <li>From January 2021 onwards, ‘On-us Transactions’ in UPI that are not processed and settled through the UPI Central System is shown under ‘On-us Transactions’ column.
                                    </li>
                                    <li>Apps which has volume less than 10,000 is included under ‘Other Apps’.</li>
                                    <li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# volume.</li>
                                </ul>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabThreeJun21" class="tab-pane">
                                <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></h5>
                                <div class="table-responsive">
                                    <table class="table table-bordered">
                                        <thead>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th colspan="7"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></th>
                                            </tr>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th rowspan="2"><strong>Month</strong></th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>Total</strong></th>

                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                                        <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>

                                <p><b>Note:</b></p>
                                <p>Mandate execution relate only to IPO applications for which the shares have been allotted. <br>Business Declines (BD) and Technical Declines (TD) are at the time of online transactions and such declines are manually processed
                                    within 24 hrs to 48 hrs.
                                </p>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Remarks</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li>Mandate Execution means transaction where the customer has applied for an IPO and has been allotted shares for which the funds are debited from the applicant’s account.</li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>

                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                            count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is
                                            termed as business Decline. </li>
                                        <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                                        <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                            is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received
                                            online from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li>Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money</li>
                                        <li>Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>

                                </div>
                                <p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
                                <ul class="list">
                                    <li>App volume in table is basis the Payer App logic, i.e the financial transaction is attributed to the PSP in UPI on the Payer’s side.</li>
                                    <li>All B2C (Business to Customer) &amp; B2B (Business to Business) transactions is attributed to respective PSP .</li>
                                    <li>From January 2021 onwards, ‘On-us Transactions’ in UPI that are not processed and settled through the UPI Central System is shown under ‘On-us Transactions’ column.
                                    </li>
                                    <li>Apps which has volume less than 10,000 is included under ‘Other Apps’.</li>
                                    <li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# volume.</li>
                                </ul>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabThreeJul21" class="tab-pane">
                                <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></h5>
                                <div class="table-responsive">
                                    <table class="table table-bordered">
                                        <thead>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th colspan="7"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></th>
                                            </tr>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th rowspan="2"><strong>Month</strong></th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>Total</strong></th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>P2P</strong></th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>P2M</strong></th>
                                            </tr>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                                <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                                <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                                <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                                <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                                <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                            </tr>
                                        </thead>
                                        <tbody>
                                            <tr>
                                                <td>July'21</td>
                                                <td>3,247.82</td>
                                                <td> 6,06,281.14 </td>
                                                <td>1,781.79 </td>
                                                <td>4,93,664.08 </td>
                                                <td>1,466.03 </td>
                                                <td>1,12,617.06</td>
                                            </tr>
                                        </tbody>
                                    </table>
                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                                        <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>

                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                            count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is
                                            termed as business Decline. </li>
                                        <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                                        <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                            is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received
                                            online from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li>Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money</li>
                                        <li>Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabTwoAug21" class="tab-pane">

                                </div>
                                <p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
                                <ul class="list">
                                    <li>App volume in table is basis the Payer App logic, i.e the financial transaction is attributed to the PSP in UPI on the Payer’s side.</li>
                                    <li>All B2C (Business to Customer) &amp; B2B (Business to Business) transactions is attributed to respective PSP .</li>
                                    <li>From January 2021 onwards, ‘On-us Transactions’ in UPI that are not processed and settled through the UPI Central System is shown under ‘On-us Transactions’ column.
                                    </li>
                                    <li>Apps which has volume less than 10,000 is included under ‘Other Apps’.</li>
                                    <li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# volume.</li>
                                </ul>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabThreeAug21" class="tab-pane">
                                <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></h5>
                                <div class="table-responsive">
                                    <table class="table table-bordered">
                                        <thead>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th colspan="7"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></th>
                                            </tr>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th rowspan="2"><strong>Month</strong></th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>Total</strong></th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>P2P</strong></th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>P2M</strong></th>
                                            </tr>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                                <th>Value (Cr)</th>

                                                <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                            </tr>
                                        </thead>
                                        <tbody>
                                            <tr>
                                                <td>Aug'21</td>
                                                <td>3,555.55 </td>
                                                <td> 6,39,116.95 </td>
                                                <td>1,945.80 </td>
                                                <td>5,16,207.43 </td>

                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                                        <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
                <div class="hideDD" id="yearSep2021" style="display: none;">
                    <div id="upiLive" class="ecoSysTabs tab-pane fade active show">

                                        Apps</a> </li>
                                <li class="nav-item"> <a class="nav-link" data-toggle="tab" href="#innerTabThreeSep21">UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</a> </li>

                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                            count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is
                                            termed as business Decline. </li>
                                        <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                                        <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                            is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received
                                            online from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li>Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money</li>
                                        <li>Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabTwoSep21" class="tab-pane">

                                </div>
                                <p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
                                <ul class="list">
                                    <li>App volume in table is basis the Payer App logic, i.e the financial transaction is attributed to the PSP in UPI on the Payer’s side.</li>
                                    <li>All B2C (Business to Customer) &amp; B2B (Business to Business) transactions is attributed to respective PSP .</li>
                                    <li>From January 2021 onwards, ‘On-us Transactions’ in UPI that are not processed and settled through the UPI Central System is shown under ‘On-us Transactions’ column.
                                    </li>
                                    <li>Apps which has volume less than 10,000 is included under ‘Other Apps’.</li>
                                    <li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# volume.</li>
                                </ul>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabThreeSep21" class="tab-pane">
                                <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></h5>
                                <div class="table-responsive">
                                    <table class="table table-bordered">
                                        <thead>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th colspan="7"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></th>
                                            </tr>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th rowspan="2"><strong>Month</strong></th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>Total</strong></th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>P2P</strong></th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>P2M</strong></th>
                                            </tr>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                                <th>Value (Cr)</th>

                                            </tr>

                                                <td>Sep'21</td>
                                                <td>3,654.30 </td>
                                                <td> 6,54,351.81 </td>
                                                <td>1,981.03 </td>
                                                <td>5,28,973.37 </td>
                                                <td>1,673.26 </td>

                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                                        <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>

                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                            count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is
                                            termed as business Decline. </li>
                                        <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                                        <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                            is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received
                                            online from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li>Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money</li>
                                        <li>Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabTwoOct21" class="tab-pane">

                                </div>
                                <p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
                                <ul class="list">
                                    <li>App volume in table is basis the Payer App logic, i.e the financial transaction is attributed to the PSP in UPI on the Payer’s side.</li>
                                    <li>All B2C (Business to Customer) &amp; B2B (Business to Business) transactions is attributed to respective PSP .</li>
                                    <li>From January 2021 onwards, ‘On-us Transactions’ in UPI that are not processed and settled through the UPI Central System is shown under ‘On-us Transactions’ column.
                                    </li>
                                    <li>Apps which has volume less than 10,000 is included under ‘Other Apps’.</li>
                                    <li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# volume.</li>
                                    <li>WhatsApp*: Maximum registered user base of forty (40) million in UPI</li>
                                </ul>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabThreeOct21" class="tab-pane">
                                <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></h5>
                                <div class="table-responsive">
                                    <table class="table table-bordered">
                                        <thead>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th colspan="7"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></th>
                                            </tr>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th rowspan="2"><strong>Month</strong></th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>Total</strong></th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>P2P</strong></th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>P2M</strong></th>
                                            </tr>

                                                <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                                <th>Value (Cr)</th>

                                            </tr>

                                            <tr>
                                                <td>Oct'21</td>
                                                <td>4,218.65 </td>
                                                <td>7,71,444.98 </td>
                                                <td>2,507.12 </td>
                                                <td>6,21,400.74 </td>
                                                <td>1,711.53 </td>

                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                                        <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>

                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                            count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is
                                            termed as business Decline. </li>
                                        <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                                        <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                            is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received
                                            online from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li>Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money</li>
                                        <li>Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabTwoNov21" class="tab-pane">

                                </div>
                                <p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
                                <ul class="list">
                                    <li>App volume in table is basis the Payer App logic, i.e the financial transaction is attributed to the PSP in UPI on the Payer’s side.</li>
                                    <li>All B2C (Business to Customer) &amp; B2B (Business to Business) transactions is attributed to respective PSP .</li>
                                    <li>From January 2021 onwards, ‘On-us Transactions’ in UPI that are not processed and settled through the UPI Central System is shown under ‘On-us Transactions’ column.
                                    </li>
                                    <li>Apps which has volume less than 10,000 is included under ‘Other Apps’.</li>
                                    <li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# volume.</li>
                                    <li>WhatsApp*: Maximum registered user base of forty (40) million in UPI</li>
                                </ul>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabThreeNov21" class="tab-pane">
                                <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></h5>
                                <div class="table-responsive">
                                    <table class="table table-bordered">
                                        <thead>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th colspan="7"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></th>
                                            </tr>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th rowspan="2"><strong>Month</strong></th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>Total</strong></th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>P2P</strong></th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>P2M</strong></th>
                                            </tr>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                                <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                                <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                                <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                                <th>Volume (Mn)</th>
                                                <th>Value (Cr)</th>
                                            </tr>
                                        </thead>
                                        <tbody>
                                            <tr>
                                                <td>Nov'21</td>
                                                <td>4,186.48</td>
                                                <td>7,68,436.11</td>
                                                <td>2,547.94</td>
                                                <td>6,18,101.55</td>
                                                <td>1,638.54</td>
                                                <td>1,50,334.56</td>
                                            </tr>
                                        </tbody>
                                    </table>
                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                                        <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>

                                                <td>50</td>
                                                <td>Karnataka Vikas Grameena Bank</td>
                                                <td>3.03</td>
                                                <td>97.50%</td>
                                                <td>0.72%</td>
                                                <td>1.07%</td>
                                                <td>0.71%</td>
                                            </tr>
                                        </tbody>
                                    </table>
                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                            count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is
                                            termed as business Decline. </li>
                                        <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                                        <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                            is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received
                                            online from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li>Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money</li>
                                        <li>Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabTwoDec21" class="tab-pane">

                                </div>
                                <p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
                                <ul class="list">
                                    <li>App volume in table is basis the Payer App logic, i.e the financial transaction is attributed to the PSP in UPI on the Payer’s side.</li>
                                    <li>All B2C (Business to Customer) &amp; B2B (Business to Business) transactions is attributed to respective PSP .</li>
                                    <li>From January 2021 onwards, ‘On-us Transactions’ in UPI that are not processed and settled through the UPI Central System is shown under ‘On-us Transactions’ column.
                                    </li>
                                    <li>Apps which has volume less than 10,000 is included under ‘Other Apps’.</li>
                                    <li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# volume.</li>
                                    <li>WhatsApp*: Maximum registered user base of forty (40) million in UPI</li>
                                </ul>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabThreeDec21" class="tab-pane">
                                <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></h5>
                                <div class="table-responsive">
                                    <table class="table table-bordered">
                                        <thead>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th colspan="7"><strong>UPI P2P and P2M Transactions</strong></th>

                                                <td>Dec'21</td>
                                                <td>4,566.30</td>
                                                <td>8,26,848.22</td>
                                                <td>2,812.00</td>
                                                <td>6,69,127.56</td>
                                                <td>1,754.30</td>

                                            </tr>
                                        </tbody>

                                </div>
                                <h5 class="mb-3 mt-4"><strong>UPI P2P & P2M transactions by Amount Banding</strong>
                                </h5>
                                <div class="border rounded mb-5">
                                    <img src="/images/npci/upi/upi-ecosystem-volume-dec21.png">
                                </div>
                                <div class="border rounded">
                                    <img src="/images/npci/upi/upi-ecosystem-value-dec21.png">
                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.</li>
                                        <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>

                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li> Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                            count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is
                                            termed as business Decline. </li>
                                        <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                                        <li> The Debit Reversal Success percentage indicates the % of total cases, where a customer account may be debited and their bank is unable to confirm instantly about the status of reversal of such a debit. When reversal/credit
                                            is not processed instantly, it is processed manually by the bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li> Deemed Approved (Pending Credit Confirmation for UPI remittance transactions) - Deemed Approved percentage indicates the total percentage of cases of the total transactions, where credit confirmations are not received
                                            online from the beneficiary banks for the credit. If the beneficiary account is not credited online, transaction would be manually processed by the beneficiary bank as per the extant RBI guidelines. </li>
                                        <li>Remitter - The account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary - The account holder who is receiving money</li>
                                        <li>Remitter Bank - The bank of the account holder who is sending the money</li>
                                        <li>Beneficiary Bank - The bank of the account holder who is receiving money
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                            <div id="innerTabTwoJan22" class="tab-pane">
                                <h5 class="mb-3"><strong>UPI Apps (Jan'22)</strong></h5>
                                <div class="table-responsive">
                                    <table class="table table-bordered">
                                        <thead>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th colspan="12"> <strong>UPI Apps (Jan'22)</strong> </th>
                                            </tr>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th rowspan="2"> <strong>Sr.No.</strong> </th>
                                                <th rowspan="2"> <strong>Application Name</strong> </th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>Customer Initiated Transactions</strong></th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>B2C Transactions</strong></th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>B2B Transactions</strong></th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>On-us Transactions</strong></th>
                                                <th colspan="2"><strong>Total</strong></th>
                                            </tr>
                                            <tr>
                                                <th> <strong>Volume (Mn)</strong> </th>
                                                <th> <strong>Value (Cr)</strong> </th>
                                                <th> <strong>Volume (Mn)</strong> </th>
                                                <th> <strong>Value (Cr)</strong> </th>
                                                <th> <strong>Volume (Mn)</strong> </th>
                                                <th> <strong>Value (Cr)</strong> </th>
                                                <th> <strong>Volume (Mn)</strong> </th>
                                                <th> <strong>Value (Cr)</strong> </th>
                                                <th> <strong>Volume (Mn)</strong> </th>

                                <p><strong>Note:- </strong></p>
                                <ul class="list">
                                    <li>App volume in table is basis the Payer App logic, i.e the financial transaction is attributed to the PSP in UPI on the Payer’s side.</li>
                                    <li>All B2C (Business to Customer) &amp; B2B (Business to Business) transactions is attributed to respective PSP .</li>
                                    <li>From January 2021 onwards, ‘On-us Transactions’ in UPI that are not processed and settled through the UPI Central System is shown under ‘On-us Transactions’ column.
                                    </li>
                                    <li>Apps which has volume less than 10,000 is included under ‘Other Apps’.</li>
                                    <li>BHIM Volume is inclusive of *99# volume.</li>
                                    <li>WhatsApp*: Maximum registered user base of forty (40) million in UPI</li>
                                </ul>
                            </div>

                                <div class="table-responsive">

                                <h5 class="mb-3 mt-4"><strong>UPI: P2P & P2M transactions by Amount Banding</strong>
                                </h5>
                                <div class="border rounded mb-5">
                                    <img src="/images/npci/upi/upi-ecosystem-volume-jan22.jpg">
                                </div>
                                <div class="border rounded">
                                    <img src="/images/npci/upi/upi-ecosystem-value-jan22.jpg">
                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li>P2P - P2P transactions are payments done by person to a person i.e. Peer to Peer Payments.
                                        </li>
                                        <li>P2M - P2M transactions are payments done by person to a merchant i.e. Peer to Merchant Payments</li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>

                                </div>
                                <h3 class="mt-3 mb-3"><b>Glossary</b></h3>
                                <div class="list">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li>Business Decline (BD) - Transaction decline due to a customer entering an invalid pin, incorrect beneficiary account etc. Or due to other business reasons such as exceeding per transaction limit, exceeding permitted
                                            count of transactions per day, exceeding amount limit for the day etc. Such declined transactions are termed as Business Decline. Any decline which is not because of a technical reason of the bank or NPCI is
                                            termed as business Decline.
                                        </li>
                                        <li>Technical Decline (TD) - Transaction decline due to technical reasons, such as unavailability of systems and network issues on bank or NPCI side.</li>
                                        <li>PSP - Payment Service Provider</li>
                                        <li>Payer PSP - Under this function a bank can onboard a customer, create his/ her UPI ID, create device binding which is used as a first factor of Authentication, using this customer can enter their UPI PIN to approve
                                            a financial transaction or non-financial request where ever necessary. </li>
                                        <li>Payee PSP - Under this function a bank can onboard a customer/merchant & allow them to receive money basis allocated UPI ID or raise a Collect request. It is also known as beneficiary PSP/resolving PSP. </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</section>

        l.href = '/fonts/npci/fonts.css';

<script>        
 var s = document.createElement('script'); s.src = "https://npci.corover.mobi/widget/res/chatbotlib.min.js"; s.type = "text/javascript"; document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(s);

 <script>
//Get the button
var mybutton = document.getElementById("myBtn");

// When the user scrolls down 20px from the top of the document, show the button
window.onscroll = function() {scrollFunction()};

function scrollFunction() {
  if (document.body.scrollTop > 20 || document.documentElement.scrollTop > 20) {
    mybutton.style.display = "block";
  } else {
    mybutton.style.display = "none";
  }
}

// When the user clicks on the button, scroll to the top of the document
function topFunction() {
  document.body.scrollTop = 0;
  document.documentElement.scrollTop = 0;
}
</script>
</body>

</html>
